channel.title: Query from Self-hosted Redash to Jira Cloud does not show all fields (e.g. "assignee")
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
The query to Jira Cloud { "jql": "labels in (big_client, jira_big_customer) AND statusCategory != Done", "fields": "issuetype,timespent,status,summary,customfield_10004,reporter,assignee,reporter" } does not show "assignee" field (values are just blank).
The same request and list of fields in Google sheet is displayed perfectly.
Please, help us to figure out the cause of suchlike issue.
Redards, Eugene.
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: 8.0.0+b32245 * Browser/OS: any * How did you install Redash: self-hosted

item.title: Query from Self-hosted Redash to Jira Cloud does not show all fields (e.g. "assignee")
item.dc:creator: davidbbn
item.description:
Hey Eugene,

Did you manage to find a solution for this?

Read full topic

item.title: Query from Self-hosted Redash to Jira Cloud does not show all fields (e.g. "assignee")
item.dc:creator: EugeneCL
item.description:
Issue Summary

The query to Jira Cloud
{
“jql”: “labels in (big_client, jira_big_customer) AND statusCategory != Done”,
“fields”: “issuetype,timespent,status,summary,customfield_10004,reporter,assignee,reporter”
}
does not show “assignee” field (values are just blank).

The same request and list of fields in Google sheet is displayed perfectly.

Please, help us to figure out the cause of suchlike issue.

Redards,
Eugene.

Technical details:

  • Redash Version: 8.0.0+b32245
  • Browser/OS: any
  • How did you install Redash: self-hosted

Read full topic
